first_para: Grant Shapps (born 14 September 1968) is a British Conservative Party politician. He is co-chairman of the Conservative Party, and incumbent election candidate for Welwyn Hatfield in England. He first won the seat, as Grant V Shapps, in the general election of 5 May 2005. Shapps was returned to parliament in the May 2010 election with a 17,423 majority. He has used the name Michael Green in his internet marketing businesses.

full.extract:
Grant Shapps (born 14 September 1968) is a British Conservative Party politician. He is co-chairman of the Conservative Party, and incumbent election candidate for Welwyn Hatfield in England. He first won the seat, as Grant V Shapps, in the general election of 5 May 2005. Shapps was returned to parliament in the May 2010 election with a 17,423 majority. He has used the name Michael Green in his internet marketing businesses.
On 9 June 2010, Shapps was appointed as a Privy Counsellor. On 4 September 2012, he was appointed Conservative Party Co-Chairman, replacing Baroness Warsi; he was also appointed Minister without portfolio in the Cabinet Office. His salary is paid by the party.
full.title: Grant Shapps
